p: Trypanosoma brucei brucei, although not infecting humans because of its susceptibility to the innate immune system, has been used as a good predictive model in a first screening for the identification of anti-trypanosomal compounds [ 52, 53]. Bloodstream forms of this parasite ( Tbb, strain 427) were grown in HMI-9 medium (IMDM-Gibco-Thermo Fisher Scientific, Merelbeke, Belgium-supplemented with 10% heat-inactivated fetal bovine serum (Sigma-Aldrich, Bornem, Belgium) and bloodstream form supporting factors) [ 54].
